title: Chelsea transfer news: Leonardo Bonucci Juventus future in doubt | Metro News
text:
Chelsea and Manchester City transfer target Leonardo Bonucci could consider Juventus future gossip Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 22 Feb 2017 10:34 am Leonardo Bonucci could reportedly look to leave Juventus (Picture: Getty) 
Chelsea and Manchester City could be boosted in their pursuit of the transfer of Leonardo Bonucci, with the defender reportedly feeling betrayed by his club. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
The Italy international was involved in a furious row with manager Massimiliano Allegri after Juve’s weekend win over Palermo, and it could lead him to consider his future in Turin, according to Calciomercato . 
Bonucci has since been left out of Juventus’ squad to take on Porto in the Champions League this week, but he would no doubt have plenty of suitors from elsewhere in Europe. Bonucci is regarded as one of the best defenders in the world (Picture: Getty) 
Chelsea and City were both linked with the 29-year-old in the summer, before he signed a new contract with Juventus, and both clubs still look in need of a top class signing at the back.
